meanings.definition: Dryness or barrenness of soil or climate.
meanings.sent1: The aridity of the desert made it difficult for plants to grow.
meanings.sent2: The aridity of the region led to water scarcity issues.
meanings.sent3: The cactus joked that the aridity of the desert was perfect for its dry humor.
meanings.sent4: The aridity of the land was like a parched canvas waiting for rain to paint it green.
meanings.sent5: The aridity of the soil was so extreme that even the hardiest plants struggled to survive.

meanings.sent1: The aridity in the air made her skin feel dry and itchy.
meanings.sent2: The aridity of the room caused the wooden furniture to crack.
meanings.sent3: The aridity of the desert air made her hair stand on end like a static electricity experiment.
meanings.sent4: The aridity of the climate sucked the moisture out of everything it touched.
meanings.sent5: The aridity of the atmosphere was so intense that even breathing felt like inhaling dust.

meanings.definition: Lack of interest, excitement, or emotion.
meanings.sent1: The aridity in his voice made it clear he was not enthusiastic about the project.
meanings.sent2: The aridity of the conversation left them both feeling bored.
meanings.sent3: The aridity of the party was broken by a sudden dance-off that brought excitement to the room.
meanings.sent4: The aridity of her expression revealed nothing about her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The aridity of the play made the audience wish for a more engaging performance.
